p: The importance of a plant family increases with the increase in the frequency of citations of all species. Figure 4 represents 11 plant families with maximum FIV, amongst which Lamiaceae was the leading family (95.23%), followed by Solanaceae (93.45%), Asteraceae (82.73%), and Rosaceae (82.14%). Acoraceae has the lowest family importance value, with 5.95% ( Table 5).
